channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Armements dotés d’IA | Un éminent chercheur met l’humanité en garde
item.description: Les dirigeants du secteur technologique sont engagés dans une « course aux armements » dotés d’intelligence artificielle qui risque d’anéantir l’humanité, a mis en garde mardi, dans un entretien à l’AFP, Stuart Russell, éminent chercheur en informatique, appelant les gouvernements à intervenir pour freiner la cadence.

item.title: Galaxy Book 6 Pro : Samsung dévoile la date de sortie de son nouveau PC
item.description: Samsung en dit plus sur le lancement de son nouveau PC portable très haut de gamme.

item.title: Apple's iPhone Air MagSafe battery pack drops to an all-time-low price
item.description:
Despite its supremely sleek design, the iPhone Air actually has a pretty respectable battery life, lasting for somewhere in the region of 27 hours if you’re continuously streaming video. But you’re still going to be wary of it dying on you if you’re on a trip or just having a particularly screen-heavy day. That’s where Apple’s iPhone Air MagSafe battery pack comes in, and it’s currently on sale for $79.
This accessory only works with the iPhone Air, but much like the phone it attaches to, it’s extremely slim at 7.5mmm, so crucially doesn’t add so much bulk when attached that it defeats the p...

item.title: Game Pass en février 2026 : The Witcher 3, Kingdom Come 2 et Towerborne arrivent dans la 2e vague du mois
item.description: Voici la liste de tous les jeux qui rejoignent le catalogue Xbox Game Pass en février 2026.

item.title: Rode’s free update unleashes wireless 'broadcast-quality audio' for iPhone — here’s how it works
item.description: Rode has released a free firmware update that owners of its Wireless Go and Wireless Pro microphones won't want to miss – here's why.

item.title: Il est possible de tripler le stockage de votre Nintendo Switch 2 pour pas cher avec cette microSD Express de Samsung à -30 %
item.description: Vous recherchez une belle promotion sur une solution de stockage conséquente pour votre Nintendo Switch 2 ? Chez Amazon, vous pourrez retrouver la microSD Samsung P9 Express de 512 Go à 99,49 euros au lieu de 139,99 euros.

item.title: Bouygues Telecom ressort son offre fibre « fin de série » à 19,99€/mois
item.description: La guerre des prix continue sur les box internet avec aujourd'hui Bouygues Telecom qui dégaine son offre Bbox « Fin de série » à 19,99€ par mois.

item.title: Valve confirms Steam Deck OLED stock issues are due to 'memory and storage shortages' — here's what it means for the Steam Machine
item.description: The RAM crisis has claimed yet another victim, with the Steam Deck OLED now out of stock intermittently in multiple regions.

item.title: Disney has released a new trailer for The Mandalorian and Grogu — and it finally shows us what the next Star Wars movie is actually about
item.description: The Mandalorian & Grogu has received a new main trailer ahead of its May 22 debut.

item.title: Sony veut tracer l’ADN des chansons générées par l’IA
item.description: L'IA générative s'est bâtie sur l'exploitation de volumes gigantesques de données, parfois obtenues sans autorisation. C'est ce qui vaut aux entreprises de l'IA de nombreuses plaintes de la part d'ayants droit. Dans le domaine musical, Sony a développé une technologie qui permettrait de rééquilibrer la situation : elle identifie les œuvres utilisées dans l'entraînement des modèles d'IA....

item.title: India bids to attract over $200B in AI infrastructure investment by 2028
item.description: India is ramping up shared AI compute, adding 20,000 GPUs as part of a broader push to attract global AI investment.

item.title: Ce FPS légendaire des années 2000 revient gratuitement sur vos PC modernes : voici comment l’installer
item.description: Des passionnés ont redoré le blason d'un titre qui a fait les beaux jours du jeu sur PC il y a plus de 20 ans. Profitez-en, c'est gratuit.

item.title: Snapchat launches creator subscription in the U.S.
item.description: Snapchat will let creators set their monthly subscription price.

item.title: Au fait, c’est quoi la différence entre « WiFi » et « Wi-Fi » ?
item.description: Dans le genre de question bête mais intéressante : y a-t-il une différence entre le WiFi et le Wi-Fi orthographié avec le trait d'union ? Ou ces deux orthographes définissent-ils vraiment la même chose ? Voici la réponse à donner (pour impressionner les gens en soirée).

item.title: The new Anker 45W Nano charger with smart display is $10 off right now
item.description: Anker introduced a nifty little charger at CES 2026, which is a refresh of the pre-existing Nano Charger. It's already on sale for $30 for Prime members, or $10 off its regular price. The 45W charger includes a smart display that shows real-time data like power flow, temperature and charging status. It also features "fun animations to keep things cheerful." Anker says it can recognize what's being charged and automatically adjust certain metrics to ensure a longer battery lifespan. To that end, it works with just about everything. The company advertises that this charger is a good fit for the...

item.title: Good news photo fans - Android phones will soon be able to back up to Google Drive
item.description: Android local backup means your Downloads folder will back up to Google Drive – iCloud already syncs downloads to the cloud.

item.title: Nothing défie Apple avec l’annonce du Nothing Phone (4a)
item.description: Nothing ne va pas se laisser effrayer par Apple. La marque lance son nouveau smartphone le lendemain de la keynote Apple de mars.

item.title: Crimson Desert dev confirms a 'monetization model' is not a feature of the upcoming RPG — 'This is a premium experience. That is the transaction. Full stop'
item.description: Pearl Abyss has confirmed Crimson Desert won't feature microtransactions or a cosmetic cash shop, calling the game a "premium experience".

item.title: This one-of-a-kind cowboy hat from Gold House and Stetson celebrates the Year of the Fire Horse in style
item.description: The Texas-made hat will be auctioned off, with proceeds going to help further the nonprofit’s work in supporting Asian-Pacific culture and entrepreneurs. Today marks the start of the Year of the Fire Horse, which in Chinese tradition is all about action, boldness, and taking on new challenges.

item.title: Finally, an Actual New ‘The Mandalorian and Grogu’ Trailer
item.description: The galaxy far, far away's journey back to the big screen becomes a little clearer in our latest look at the next 'Star Wars' movie.

item.title: Inside the Homeland Security Forum Where ICE Agents Talk Shit About Other Agents
item.description: Forum members have discussed their discomfort with mass deportation efforts, debate how federal agents have interacted with civilians, and complain about their working conditions.

item.title: Peak Design has wearable gadget straps for people who hate bags
item.description: Peak Design is launching a lineup of mobile straps for carrying small gadgets and other essentials around without dumping them into a bag. There are three versions available starting today: a $29.95 Mobile Cuff for your wrist, a $49.95 two-point Crossbody Strap, and a $59.95 Crossbody Multi-Strap that allows you to carry several items at […]

item.title: SpendRule raises $2M, emerges from stealth to help hospitals track spending
item.description: SpendRule, launched last summer, is an AI-powered platform that helps healthcare systems track their spending.

item.title: Just 8 months in, India’s vibe-coding startup Emergent claims ARR of over $100M
item.description: Indian vibe-coding platform Emergent was launched just eight months ago, and it now says it's generating annual recurring revenue of more than $100 million, thanks to surging demand by small businesses and non-technical users.

item.title: Qodo 2.1 solves your coding agents' 'amnesia' problem, giving them an 11% precision boost
item.description: As AI-powered coding tools flood the market, a critical weakness has emerged: by default, as with most LLM chat sessions, they are temporary — as soon as you close a session and start a new one, the tool forgets everything you were just working on. Developers have worked around this by having coding tools and agents save their state to markdown and text files, but this solution is hacky at best. Qodo, the AI code review startup, believes it has a solution with the launch of what it calls the industry's first intelligent Rules System for AI governance — a framework that gives AI code reviewers ...

item.title: SurrealDB 3.0 wants to replace your five-database RAG stack with one
item.description: Building retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems for AI agents often involves using multiple layers and technologies for structured data, vectors and graph information. In recent months it has also become increasingly clear that agentic AI systems need memory, sometimes referred to as contextual memory, to operate effectively.The complexity and synchronization of having different data layers to enable context can lead to performance and accuracy issues. It's a challenge that SurrealDB is looking to solve.SurrealDB on Tuesday launched version 3.0 of its namesake database alongside a $23 mi...

item.title: Tide spent 10 years turning laundry detergent into a tile. Please don’t eat it
item.description: Shaped like a small tile, Tide evo is a new form factor for laundry detergent that was designed to eliminate everything but the most essential cleaning agents. For the past decade—and really, for its entire 84-year history—the laundry detergent brand Tide has been trying to simplify the process of doing of laundry. From its original all-in-one powder to 1980s-era liquid soap to the 2012 introduction of the packet-based Tide Pod, the brand and its parent company Procter and Gamble have regularly reformulated the core product to accommodate the seemingly simple but highly diverse act of washing ...

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery gives Paramount one week to present its ‘best and final’ offer
item.description: After rejecting Paramount's latest acquisition bid, Warner Bros. Discovery says it's giving the David Ellison-led entertainment giant seven days to make its "best and final" proposal. Though WBD is reopening negotiations with Paramount, the company makes it clear in a press release that it still favors Netflix's $82.7 billion deal to purchase its studio and […]...

item.title: Ce laptop gaming MSI ultra-puissant (Ultra 9 + RTX 5090) perd 1 300 € de son prix chez la Fnac et Darty
item.description: Avec sa configuration musclée, le MSI Vector 16 HX AI A2XWJG‑494FR s’adresse clairement aux joueurs exigeants et aux créateurs en quête d'une machine solide pour enchaîner les tâches les plus lourdes. Un modèle qui n'est pas donné, mais qui est moins cher en ce moment : 3 299 euros au lieu de 4 599 euros.

item.title: I tested the Netgear Nighthawk M7 on 5G and Wi-Fi 7 - and it’s brilliant as long as your network is strong
item.description: This Wi-Fi 7-enabled 5G mobile hotspot router is one of the first to feature global eSIM support, enabling you to purchase short-term eSIMs from multiple locations worldwide. Wi-Fi performance is solid, making this a perfect partner for anyone who travels and wants their own Wi-Fi hotspot without worrying about the security of public Wi-Fi.

item.title: Elevation Lab's AirTag 10-year extended battery case is only $16 right now
item.description: AirTags are basically an essential accessory for iPhone users who want to keep track of things like their keys, wallet and backpack. While it's easy enough to replace the battery in both versions of the AirTag, you may not want to have to rush to do so at the end of the battery's roughly two-year lifespan. That's where Elevation Lab's extended battery case for the AirTag comes in, and it's heavily discounted right now: it's 30 percent off and down to $16. The case usually sells for $23, so that's a 30 percent discount. It's not the first time we've seen this deal, but it's a pretty decent one ...

item.title: Brits are turning their backs on US Big Tech — and looking to Europe for privacy
item.description: Geopolitical tensions and privacy fears are driving a wedge between UK users and US tech giants, with a majority now seeking closer-to-home alternatives for their digital lives.

item.title: The Reverend Jesse Jackson, an icon of the Civil Rights movement, has died at 84
item.description: Jackson ran for president twice and did better than any Black politician had before President Barack Obama. The Reverend Jesse L. Jackson, a protege of the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr. and two-time presidential candidate who led the Civil Rights Movement for decades after the revered leader’s assassination, died Tuesday. He was 84.As a young organizer in Chicago, Jackson was called to meet with King at the Lorraine Motel in Memphis shortly before King was killed and he publicly positioned himself thereafter as King’s successor.Jackson led a lifetime of crusades in the United States and abro...

item.title: Millions of Iranians could lose access to VPNs 'as of next week' due to lack of US funding
item.description: The Open Technology Fund warns that millions of VPN users in Iran could lose access to the tools as early next week if US agencies don't replenish the group's funds.

item.title: The 512GB Samsung P9 microSD Express card is 33 percent off
item.description: If you're looking to expand the storage on your Switch 2, the 512GB Samsung P9 microSD Express card is on sale right now for 33 percent off, marked down to $80 from $120. With component prices skyrocketing these days, it's getting increasingly rare to see good storage on sale, and 512GB for $80 is a much better deal than you'll currently find directly from Nintendo. The P9 boasts transfer speeds of up to 800MB/s, making moving games to the card that much faster. As for load times, in our testing we found that any microSD Express, the standard the Switch 2 requires, will offer roughly the same ...

item.title: Produits illégaux, design addictif : Shein dans le viseur de Bruxelles
item.description: Cela pendait au nez de Shein depuis quelques semaines : la Commission européenne a ouvert une enquête formelle contre la plateforme chinoise, dans le cadre du règlement sur les services numériques (DSA). Elle va devoir s'expliquer sur la présence de produits illégaux dans ses rayons — notamment des poupées pédopornographiques —, mais aussi sur son design « addictif » ou encore ses systèmes de recommandation....

item.title: I tested the Peladn HO5-370 mini PC, and it handled 4K editing and all my office work with ease
item.description: Compact, high-powered workstation that provides plenty of power for day-to-day office tasks and creative applications. The premium pricing ensures a cutting-edge CPU and GPU, and it certainly impresses in terms of outright performance. If you need more powerful graphics to complement the processing power, there’s an OCuLink port to support an external GPU....

item.title: Intel l’a confirmé : un nouveau GPU sortira chaque année, et voici son plan pour rattraper la concurrence
item.description: Intel a explicité un peu mieux sa politique en matière de cartes graphiques professionnelles et grand public. La firme mise sur l'IA comme levier de croissance pour le segment GPU de son activité, évoque la place prédominante du logiciel dans son approche et réaffirme son projet de lancement annuel.

item.title: Apple's 14-inch MacBook Pro M5 is up to $300 off
item.description: Apple released its new 14-inch MacBook Pro M5 in October with little fanfare. But, despite the underselling, we found the device to be a great upgrade to its predecessor and the best MacBook for creatives. Now, you can find out for yourself with less of a strain on your wallet, thanks to a big sale. Currently, B&H has discounts available for a variety of configurations. The cheapest option is the MacBook Pro M5 with 16GB of RAM and 512GB of SSD. It's available in Space Black and Silver for $1,499, down from $1,599 — the lowest price we've seen for it. There's also a deal on the 24GB of RAM op...

item.title: Pick up a bundle of four first-gen AirTags for only $64
item.description:
At this point, you can find discounts on AirTags fairly often but if you want to spend as little as possible, it's worth waiting for a discount like this. A four-pack of the first-gen Bluetooth trackers is on sale for $64, which is just about a record-low price (only $1 more). That's a 35 percent discount on the pack. Bear in mind that this deal brings the price per AirTag down to about $16 if you were to buy them individually, and when not on sale they usually cost $29.
If you use Apple devices and consider yourself to be a serial thing-misplacer, AirTags are extremely useful. Adding one t...

item.title: Top Japanese hotel brand reveals cyberattack - Washington hotels hit by ransomware
item.description: An investigation is underway into Washington hotel attackers, but no group has claimed responsibility yet.

item.title: Adani pledges $100B to build AI data centers as India seeks bigger role in the global AI race
item.description: Adani's plan targets up to 5 gigawatts of capacity, with data centers planned alongside partnerships with Google, Microsoft, and Flipkart.

item.title: IKEA home office trends: give your workspace the natural touch with lamps, lights, and accessories in bamboo, rattan, and pine
item.description: Bamboo, rattan, and pine office accessories that will add a breath of spring to your working day.

item.title: Rachat de Warner Bros : Paramount a 7 jours pour proposer une offre finale, Warner sur le point de trahir Netflix ?
item.description: Retournement de situation en vue ? Alors que Warner Bros. a déjà donné son accord pour vendre une partie de ses actifs à Netflix, le géant du divertissement envisagerait de reprendre les discussions avec Paramount qui vient d'avancer une offre de rachat alléchante.

item.title: Une étoile géante s'est complètement éteinte brusquement sous nos yeux : mais pourquoi et comment ?
item.description: « Non seulement l’Univers est plus étrange que nous l’imaginons, mais il est plus étrange que nous ne pouvons l’imaginer » est une citation souvent faussement attribuée à l'astrophysicien britannique Arthur Eddington. À peu de choses près, elle semble en fait devoir être attribuée à son...

item.title: Krispy Kreme is giving away free doughnuts today for Fat Tuesday 2026. There’s just one tiny catch
item.description: The doughnut chain known for its freewheeling freebies is offering an original glazed doughnut on the day before Ash Wednesday. Here’s what to know. This should come as a shock to very few people, but Krispy Kreme doughnuts, which typically needs very little reason to give away its doughnuts, is giving away free doughnuts today.

item.title: 'This is the hill I’m going to die on' — David Baldacci takes on OpenAI in a battle over stolen creative work
item.description: Bestselling author David Baldacci vows to fight OpenAI over AI use of copyrighted material, calling it "the hill I’m going to die on”.

item.title: Laurie Spiegel on the difference between algorithmic music and ‘AI’
item.description: In 1986, electronic music pioneer Laurie Spiegel created Music Mouse, a way for those with a Mac, Atari, or Amiga computer to dabble in algorithmic music creation. Music Mouse is deceptively simple: Notes are arranged on an XY grid, and you play it by moving a mouse around. Back in 1986, the computer mouse was […]

item.title: Airbnb expands its “Reserve Now, Pay Later” globally
item.description: The feature allows users to cancel eligible bookings if there is a change of plans -- without losing money upfront.

item.title: This startup is using AI to cut hospital alarms—and may soon help patients get home faster
item.description: CalmWave uses medical data to understand patient danger signs and will soon spot when they’re on the road to recovery. Hospital intensive care units are notoriously noisy, with medical equipment emitting alarms, beeps, and other alerts designed to grab the attention of overextended healthcare workers.

item.title: God of War Sons of Sparta 'is not God of War' says series creator — 'I don't like it, I don't recommend it'
item.description: God of War franchise creator David Jaffe has bashed the 2D sidescrolling spin-off, God of War Sons of Sparta, saying he doesn't recommend it to fans.

item.title: As AI jitters rattle IT stocks, Infosys partners with Anthropic to build ‘enterprise-grade’ AI agents
item.description: Under the partnership, Infosys plans to integrate Anthropic's Claude models into its Topaz AI platform to build so-called "agentic" systems.

item.title: Europe probes Shein's addictive app design and illegal product sales
item.description: The European Commission (EC) has opened an investigation into low-cost fast fashion retailer Shein. EC officials are concerned about the sale of illegal products, including child sexual abuse material, as well as the potentially addictive design of its shopping experience. The Commission found fellow low-cost retailer Temu in violation of the Digital Services Act after a similar investigation last year. The probe is being opened under the Digital Services Act, a set of EU rules governing online services. The Commission will examine how Shein drives engagement with shoppers, including using a p...

item.title: Galaxy Buds 4 et 4 Pro : une fuite massive dévoile tout des futurs écouteurs de Samsung
item.description: À quelques jours de leur annonce avec les Galaxy S26, les Galaxy Buds 4 et Buds 4 Pro n'ont plus de secrets. Voici ce que Samsung nous prépare.
